entry.title: Absolute Motosport to Close Roseburg and Grants Pass Locations After December 31
entry.summary: Absolute Motosport has announced it will close its Roseburg and Grants Pass locations after December 31. A liquidation sale is underway with unmarked pricing and deep discounts on all in-stock inventory. The Roseburg store is open Monday through Wednesday, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.

entry.title: December 23, 2025
entry.summary: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop

entry.title: WIND ADVISORY FOR CENTRAL DOUGLAS COUNTY AND ITS EASTERN FOOTHILLS
entry.summary: December 23, 2025 4;00 a.m. A Wind Advisory remains in effect from 10:00 p.m. Tuesday through 10:00 am. Wednesday for central Douglas County and its eastern foothills, plus other adjacent areas in the region. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that a surface low pressure...

entry.title: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR MOUNTAIN AREAS
entry.summary: December 23, 2025 3:50 a.m. A Winter Weather Advisory remains in effect from 10:00 a.m. Tuesday through 10:00 a.m. Wednesday for mountain areas in parts of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said the Advisory is for elevations above 5,500 feet in the Cascade Mountains and includes Crater Lake. Winds are expected to...

entry.title: WATERMAIN BREAK ON WEST HARVARD AVENUE SATURDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: December 23, 2025 3:40 a.m. A watermain break at the intersection of West Harvard Avenue and West Umpqua Street on Saturday night caused a mess and the City of Roseburg is working to fix the situation. Public Works Director Ryan Herinckx told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that a leak began just after...

entry.title: TWO CITIES ANNOUNCE ADDITIONAL CLOSURES FOR THE HOLIDAYS
entry.summary: December 23, 2025 3:30 a.m. Two cities in Douglas County have announced additional holiday closures. City Recorder Cindy Sarti said the City of Winston will be closed on Wednesday, Thursday and Friday and again on January first. City Recorder Joanna Bilbrey said the City of Myrtle Creek will close at 12:00 p.m. on Wednesday, in...

entry.title: ELECTRICAL FIRE CONTAINED IN ONE FROOM
entry.summary: December 23, 2025 3:20 a.m. An electrical fire was contained in one room of a residential structure on Sunday. Information from the City of Roseburg Fire Department said just after 9:30 a.m. firefighters responded to the fire at a home on Northeast Russell Avenue. Cow Creek Tribal Police arrived on the scene before fire units...

entry.title: SHERIFF’S OFFICE TO PARTICIPATE IN ENHANCED DUII PATROLS
entry.summary: December 23, 2025 3:05 a.m. During the holiday season, the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office is partnering with the U.S. Department of Transportation’s National Highway Traffic Safety Administration and Oregon Impact to share the message about the dangers of drunk driving. Undersheriff Brad O’Dell said the agencies want all drivers to remember a lifesaving message: Drive...

entry.title: ROSEBURG SCHOOLS INVITES COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO JON NEW COMMUNITY FACILITIES ADVISORY COMMITTEE
entry.summary: December 23, 2025 2:50 a.m. Roseburg Schools is inviting community members to join a new Community Facilities Advisory Committee. A district release said committee members will take a close look at needs such as aging infrastructure, safety and security, student privacy and accessibility, improved quality and building systems that support student wellness, and learning space...

entry.title: Cash Stolen After ATM Damaged at Rogue Credit Union in Roseburg
entry.summary: Roseburg Police are investigating an early-morning ATM theft at Rogue Credit Union on NW Garden Valley Blvd. Officers found a damaged ATM and a stolen pickup left running at the scene. Two suspects fled in a white SUV. The investigation is ongoing.

entry.title: LOCAL BUSINESS CLOSURE – COLORCRAFT PAINT
entry.summary: Colorcraft Paint, located next to the former Waldron’s Outdoor Sports on Garden Valley Blvd, has closed after serving the Roseburg community for 70 years. The longtime local business thanked the community as it marked the end of an era.

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE INVESTIGATE THEFT FROM ATM, WHICH WAS DAMAGED
entry.summary: December 23, 2025 4:50 p.m. Roseburg Police are investigating the theft of money from an automatic teller machine which was damaged at a credit union early Friday morning. An RPD report said at 4:10 a.m. officers responded to a panic/ATM alarm at Rogue Credit Union in the 1300 block of Northwest Garden Valley Boulevard. Upon...

entry.title: SHERIFF’S OFFICE TO PARTICIPATE IN ENHANCED DUII PATROLS THIS HOLIDAY SEASON
entry.summary: The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office will conduct enhanced DUII patrols from December 10 through January 1 as part of the Drive Sober or Get Pulled Over campaign, focusing on removing impaired drivers from local roadways during the holiday season.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 12.22.25
entry.summary: State Representative Virgle Osbourne talks about the gas tax repeal ballot measure, the upcoming short session of the legislature and other topics.

entry.title: WILDLIFE SAFARI’S WILD LIGHTS BRINGS HOLIDAY MAGIC TO WINSTON
entry.summary: Wildlife Safari’s Wild Lights brings holiday magic to Winston with illuminated paths, animal encounters, hot cocoa, Santa visits, and the popular Candy Cane Caboose. With one weekend left, families still have time to enjoy this seasonal tradition.

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL WOMAN FOR DRIVING WHILE SUSPENDED EARLY FRIDAY
entry.summary: December 22, 2205 11:00 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a woman for a misdemeanor count of driving while suspended early Friday morning. An RPD report said at 2:00 a.m. officers stopped the vehicle in the 2600 block of Northwest Edenbower Boulevard. They recognized the driver as a 58-year-old Myrtle Creek woman whose license was revoked in...

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL MAN FOR UNLAWFUL ENTRY TO MOTOR VEHICLE
entry.summary: December 22, 2025 10:45 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a man on the charge of unlawful entry into a motor vehicle on Thursday morning. An RPD report said at 7:50 a.m. officers contacted 38-year-old Keith Weatherford in the 100 block of Sunshine Road regarding a previous case involving several vehicle break ins. During the incident, Weatherford...

entry.title: ONE VEHICLE ROLLS, ONE HITS GO-CART ON INTERSTATE 5
entry.summary: December 22, 2025 10:30 a.m. One vehicle rolled after swerving to miss a go-cart while a second vehicle hit the go-cart in a lane of travel on Interstate 5 southbound on Saturday night. An Oregon State Police report said shortly after 9:00 p.m. the crash was called in, in the southbound lane of travel near...

entry.title: Roseburg Schools calls on community for facilities committee input
entry.summary: Roseburg Schools is inviting community members to join a new Community Facilities Advisory Committee. This group will help assess the condition of aging school buildings and explore long-term facility needs.

entry.title: DRIVER LOSES CONTROL OF VEHICLE DUE TO WET WEATHER
entry.summary: December 22, 2025 10:00 a.m. A driver lost control of her vehicle, due to wet weather on Sunday afternoon. An Oregon State Police report said just before 2:45 p.m. troopers were dispatched to the single-vehicle wreck on Interstate 5 northbound, about two miles south of the Canyon Creek exit. The driver stated that she was...

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL MAN FOR CRIMINAL TRESPASS, MISCHIEF COUNTS
entry.summary: December 22, 2025 9:40 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a man for second-degree criminal trespass, and third-degree criminal mischief on Thursday morning. An RPD report said at 8:15 a.m. the 59-year-old was contacted in the 1300 block of Northeast Stephens Street after a caller said that he was sleeping in front of a business. Before leaving...

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL WOMAN FOR OFFENSIVE LITTERING
entry.summary: December 22, 2025 9:30 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a woman for offensive littering early Thursday morning. An RPD report said at 12:40 a.m. the 39-year-old was contacted at Eagles Park in the 700 block of Southeast Jackson Street. She was camping in a prohibited area and was surrounded by refuse. The woman was charged for...

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL MAN FOR WARRANT, CITE FOR CAMPING
entry.summary: December 22, 2025 9:20 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a man for a warrant and cited him for camping early Thursday morning. An RPD report said at 5:40 a.m. the 47-year-old was contacted at Gaddis Park in the 800 block of Northwest Highland Street. He was taken into custody due to the warrant. He was camping...

entry.title: WISH UPON A STAR 12.22.25
entry.summary: Wish #10: From Brooke Communications and Rogue Credit Union, we wrap up Wish Upon a Star with assistance for Michelle, who is moving out of the shelter.

entry.title: December 22, 2025
entry.summary: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop

entry.title: RFP Dillard plywood layoffs settlements come to a close
entry.summary: On Sept. 25, Roseburg Forest Products (RFP) announced it had discontinued operations at its hardwood plywood facility in Dillard, leading to layoffs for more than 100 employees.

entry.title: ODOT lays out upcoming projects to continue into new year
entry.summary: As the year comes to a close, the Oregon Department of Transportation (ODOT) is looking forward to a year of new and ongoing projects intended to make roads safer for motorists and pedestrians alike.

entry.title: Sutherlin Timber Town Toy Land Electric Light Parade returns for 33rd year
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — As Cody Salberg handed out hot drinks and snacks to a crowd of smiling faces, it occurred to her that this kind of happiness and togetherness is what Sutherlin is all about.

entry.title: Oregon anglers get a bigger lingcod limit in 2026 per ODFW Commission
entry.summary: Coastal anglers will be able to keep more lingcod in 2026, while Oregon’s general marine bag limit for rockfish and other nearshore species will remain at four fish per day.

entry.title: CONTINUED SHOWERS EXPECTED THIS WEEK IN THE UMPQUA VALLEY
entry.summary: December 22, 2025 3:50 a.m. A couple more weather systems moving through the region are expected to bring continued showers in the Umpqua Valley leading up to Christmas Day. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the heaviest rain will likely be Tuesday evening heading...

entry.title: FIFTH WHEEL DAMAGED IN FRIDAY NIGHT FIRE
entry.summary: December 22, 205 3:40 a.m. A fifth wheel was damaged in a fire on Friday night in the Drain area. A report from North Douglas County Fire and EMS said the fire was reported just before 11:30 p.m. in the 7500 block of Laurel Hill Drive. The front end of the vehicle received heavy fire...

entry.title: CITY OF ROSEBURG BUILDINGS TO CLOSE FOR CHRISTMAS, NEW YEARS
entry.summary: December 22, 2025 3:30 a.m. City of Roseburg buildings will be closed this Thursday and Friday for the Christmas holiday and Thursday, January 1st, for the New Year holiday. A city release said that means that Roseburg City Hall and the Roseburg Public Safety Center, both on Southeast Douglas Avenue, and Roseburg Public Library on...

entry.title: LUNCHBOX EXPRESS DELIVERING FREE MEALS OVER WINTER BREAK
entry.summary: December 22, 2025 3:20 a.m. Roseburg Schools has the Lunchbox Express Van delivering free meals over the Winter Break. A district release said the service helps to ensure that children have access to healthy food and steady support while school is out. Meals are available Monday and Tuesday of this week and again next Monday...

entry.title: WILD SPRING CHINOOK HARVEST PROHIBITED ON MAINSTEM UMPQUA
entry.summary: December 22, 2025 3:05 a.m. On Friday, the Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife announced a temporary rule prohibiting wild spring Chinook salmon harvest on the mainstem Umpqua River and keeping the North Umpqua bag limit the same as 2025. An ODFW release said from February 1st through June 30th: *Mainstem Umpqua River: only hatchery...

entry.title: MERKLEY: NOW IS THE TIME FOR COMMONSENSE CANNABIS REFORMS
entry.summary: December 22, 2025 2:50 a.m. Last week, Oregon’s U.S. Senator Jeff Merkley – the lead sponsor of the bipartisan SAFER Banking Act – issued a statement in response to President Trump’s announcement that he has signed an Executive Order directing the U.S. Department of Justice to complete the process of moving cannabis from Schedule I...

entry.title: Sutherlin Timber Town Toy Land Electric Light Parade Raises $7,000, Honors 2025 Winners
entry.summary: Sutherlin’s Timber Town Toy Land Electric Light Parade featured 79 vehicles, raised $7,000 in sponsorships, and paid out all prize money across multiple categories while reflecting on nearly two decades of community tradition.

entry.title: Storms Damage Trails and Recreation Areas Across Oregon State Forests
entry.summary: Recent storms have damaged trails and recreation areas across Oregon State Forests. Downed trees, erosion, and hazardous conditions are being reported as crews and volunteers work to assess and repair impacts. Visitors are urged to use caution this winter.

entry.title: A Heartfelt Goodbye To Parrott House And A New Beginning For Fun Cuisine
entry.summary: A cherished chapter in Roseburg dining is ending as Fun Cuisine prepares to leave the historic Parrott House due to the property being sold. While the location is closing, the business will continue catering and plans to reopen soon as a new Italian bistro.
